text: The South Island is the larger of the two main islands of New Zealand. It is separated from the North Island by Cook Strait. The South Island covers and has a temperate climate. It is also known by its MƒÅori name, Te Wai Pounamu. About 24% of New Zealand's population live in the South Island. ==Related pages== * North Island * Chatham Islands ==References== Category:Islands of New Zealand Category:Pacific islands
title: South Island
